wikipedia_page.main: Billy "Uke" Scott (12 March 1923 – 23 November 2004) was a British music hall star, who inspired three generations of ukulele players, composing, singing and writing a "teach-yourself" ukulele manual.

response: Other artists to make eminent use of the banjolele were Wendell Hall and Roy Smeck in the United States, and Billy "Uke" Scott in Great Britain.
*Billy "Uke" Scott (1923–2004), British music hall performer and ukulele player
* 23 – Billy "Uke" Scott, British ukulele player, composer, singer, and entertainer (born 1923).
